metadata.title: CVE-2016-8605 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: The mkdir procedure of GNU Guile temporarily changed the process' umask tozero. During that time window, in a multithreaded application, otherthreads could end up creating files with insecure permissions. For example,mkdir without the optional mode argument would create directories as 0777.This is fixed in Guile 2.0.13. Prior versions are affected.

criterions.comment: guile-2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
guile-1.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
